## GI Tract Anatomy

:::::: columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
-   Esophagus delivers food to the stomach
-   Stomach stores food and delivers it in small quantities to the jejunum
-   Jejunum begins digestion in the small intestines
:::

:::: {.column width="50%"}
::: {.content-visible unless-format="docx"}
![](https://deidt7p41jzcy.cloudfront.net/Eso_Anatomy_Labels.png)
:::
::::
::::::

::: {.content-hidden unless-format="docx"}
Normally, food passes from the mouth into the esophagus, and then into the stomach. The stomach serves as a reservoir for food, to allow you to eat a big Thanksgiving. The stomach starts digestion, and then after the meal slowly allows small portions of food to pass into the small intestines, where most of the digestion occurs.
:::
